ingredients: 2 cloves garlic, minced, or ½ teaspoon garlic powder
1 can (15 ounces) diced or crushed tomatoes with juice
1 teaspoon dried oregano or basil, or Italian seasoning (optional)
instructions: If using garlic powder, omit the oil and skip this step. In a medium saucepan, heat the oil over medium heat.
Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Cook until heated through, stirring occasionally.
For a thicker sauce, cook an extra 10 to 20 minutes to allow more of the liquid to evaporate.
Serve over pasta or use in any recipe that calls for pasta sauce.
cooking_tips: If you want a bolder tomato flavor, use crushed tomatoes instead of diced.
Taste and adjust seasonings as needed.  Canned tomatoes can vary in saltiness.
For a smoother sauce, blend with an immersion blender or in a regular blender after cooking.
